Fuse::Transactional

Fuse::Transactional Interface Reference

Inheritance diagram for Fuse::Transactional:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Simple transaction definition.

Fuse.Channel supports transactions. This are used for operations which may be canceled by the kernel. beginTransaction() is called before returning the result to the kernel. If the kernel accepts, then commitTransaction() is called, otherwise abortTransaction() is called.

See also:
Fuse.Channel


Public Member Functions

object beginTransaction ()
 start the transaction
bool commitTransaction (object data)
void abortTransaction (object data)
